text:
Another cool surprise found at Yishun Park, in Singapore‚Äôs Northeast ‚Äì remnants of an ancient rainforest survive and thrive in this unusually large, cool, shady Dipterocarp Arboretum. Sited in the midst of of a housing estate, this is an ‚Äúoff the beaten track‚Äù gem, well worth searching out.

Oh, and don't let the images of large buttress and surface roots put you off. Like much of Singapore, this haven of greenery has smooth, wide bitumen paths suitable for strollers, wheelchairs, pedestrians, and cyclists alike ‚Äì and some gentle rises for the runners..

Come mindfully, meditate, and enjoy the silence, and the song of the forest.
üòä
Quite a good park to exercise and for a walk for the residents around there. Yishun Park Hawker Center & Safra Yishun is just around it.

A living gallery of trees for education and research, Yishun Park Diptercarp Arboretum is part of NParks initiative to showcase the dominant rainforest trees unique to our region. This Arboretum is the first of its kind within a residential estate.
Its a quite place at night and a good place to unwind.
the most i like about this place is it's dog park.overall nothing special but nothing bad as well
